page.title: 03Law and order
page.content: In 1985, Shevington has one policeman, Bill McMath, who lives in the village centre. He gets around on his bicycle. Although he is on duty 8 hours a day on a shift system he does get time off to be with his family. He wears a black uniform with silver buttons (to identify himself from other members of the public) consisting of a tall hat, trousers, a coat, belt and black boots. Part of his job involves checking on local property, cars wrongly parked and ensuring that alcohol is not sold to underage people. Bill also goes into local schools, getting to know the children, passing on good advice and warnings. There is little violence in the village but assistance can be called by radio and help will arrive in a short time.
